item.title: Sony Interactive Entertainment files lawsuit against Tencent for Horizon ‘clone’ Light of Motiram
item.content:encoded:
Sony allegedly declined Horizon collaboration with Tencent in 2024.

Sony Interactive Entertainment has filed a lawsuit against Tencent in California federal court, alleging that the company ripped off its Horizon series of video games with the November 2024-announced title Light of Motiram, according to a Reuters report.

The lawsuit describes Light of Motiram as a “slavish clone” featuring identical gameplay, story themes, and artistic elements to Horizon, as well as other similarities.

Sony Interactive Entertainment also said in the lawsuit that it declined an offer from Tencent to collaborate on a new Horizon game in 2024, before Tencent announced Light of Motiram.

According to the lawsuit, journalists have described Light of Motiram as a “knock-off” of Horizon, including one who called the game “Horizon Zero Originality.”

Sony Interactive Entertainment asked the court for an unspecified amount in monetary damages, and an order blocking Tencent from violating its intellectual property rights.

Neither Sony Interactive Entertainment or Tencent immediately responded to Reuters’ requests for comment.

Despite the lawsuit, Sony Interactive Entertainment Shanghai posted on its social channels in November 2024 that Light of Motiram would also be released for PlayStation 5, suggesting that the company had no issue with the game’s similarities to the Horizon series. While the Weibo and Bililbi posts have since been removed, the Weibo post is still accessible via Archive.org.

item.title: Witchfire Early Access ‘Webgrave’ update now available
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Explore the streets of Velmorne.

The Astronauts have released the “Webgrave” update for the Early Access version of dark fantasy first-person shooter Witchfire, which adds a new, multi-layered region to explore, various powerful new gear, a new system for expanding the Preyer’s abilities, new onboarding, and a number of fixes and quality improvements.

Get the details below.

The “Webgrave” update introduces yet another location to a world dominated by the Witch—Velmorne was once a town like any other, until its residents were twisted by witchcraft. Disfigured and unformed, they roam deserted corners and squares, and ambush any foolish enough to wander down its forgotten roads. The update also brings a long requested, comprehensive tutorial, set on a new map that precedes first visit to the Hermitory, and allows players returning to the world of Witchfire to refresh their memories.

“Webgrave” is also bringing a number of revamped mechanics –

  • Workshop and Stats 2.0 – The weapon and gear research system and player stats have been rebuilt for better clarity.
  • Rosary Beads – A new system to customize the Preyer’s abilities, Rosary Beads, joins the game to give players new build options to discover.
  • New Difficulty – Gnosis VI, an even higher difficulty level for those most advanced and versed in Preyer combat, raises the stakes for long-time players.

Witchfire is currently in Early Access for PC via Steam and Epic Games Store.
